column5: Leeches are pretty much gone in NW Ontario. Have been for a few weeks. The very hot spring coupled with just a couple of trappers means short supply. Sunset Baits in Kenora which had one of the only supplies the past few weeks is basically out and assuming they are done for the season. I buy 10 lbs a week for my guests and I too gave up a few weeks ago. Go with crawlers. Work great. -FT
If only people would listen to you chowder,it make there life lot easier!
you got that right ! Did you google blueberries ?........LOL LOL.LOL.
Ya I googled blueberries,and your name popped up,so I knew I was on the right site.lol
Ok, good so now you know how well blueberries grow after a fire in the Canadian bush !
Now if I could only light a few lakes on fire,to see if the fish grow bigger!

Hi--was up at Nestor Falls last week, and had very minimal success in finding leeches. The Bite-Me tackle shop was completely out, and the Nestor Falls Bait Shop had a small supply, but wanted $19.75 for two dozen. Is there a bait shop in Fort Frances that anyone here can recommend? Or is this just going to be a summer-long problem? Heading back up that way in another 6 weeks or so for another trip. Thanks in advance for any info. anyone can provide.
To be honest with you I'd forget the leeches and get crawlers ! Jig and a piece of crawler is all you need. Don't go spreading that around !
I just bought a pound of leeches a week ago at Westside Bait and Tackle in Fort Frances
Ten days ago I bought a 1/2 pound from Rainy Sports. Not much for size, but they were healthy and caught plenty of big eyes.
No, we were doing an outpost trip with Nestor Falls Outposts.
